summary_comment: Professor Chaplow is known for delivering easy-to-understand lectures and material that align closely with exam questions, making his classes straightforward if students attend regularly and complete weekly assignments. Students appreciate his knowledge and genuine interest in his subject matter, though some find his teaching style and exams to be passively challenging at times.
summary_comment_short: Professor Chaplow is known for delivering straightforward and easily understandable lectures, with exams closely aligned to the material covered. Students appreciate his knowledge and genuine interest in the subject, though some find his teaching style passive-aggressive and the exams challenging without clear justification.

Ratings.comment: Homework can be done just reviewing lecture slides, exams are based on lectures. Super easy class and material is easy to understand.

Dr. Chaplow is the man. He is very very intelligent, and so knowledgable on just about everything. It's clear he wants you to succeed. His class is very easy with just one assignment a week and exams are straight out of the lecture. Show up, submit an assignment a week, do decent on the exams and you have an A+.
Made material easy to understand and has a genuine care for his field which is reflected in his teaching/lectures.

I've had Dr. Chaplow for both 4525 and 5416, and I've really enjoyed having him as a professor. As long as you come to class and read the chapters, you will do well on exams. He really wants you to succeed.
Super passive aggressive and tests were hard for no reason

SEI.Subject: KNHES
SEI.Class Name: Promoting Behavior Change in Sport, Leisure, & Exercise

summary_comment: Professor Dunlevy is highly regarded for her engaging and prepared lectures, which students find both entertaining and informative. Her exams are considered fair and straightforward, provided students pay attention and study diligently. However, some students note that her grading system is heavily weighted towards exams, which can be challenging for those who struggle with consistent performance.
summary_comment_short: Professor Dunlevy is highly regarded for her engaging and prepared lectures, which students find both entertaining and informative. Her exams are considered fair and straightforward, provided students attend lectures and study diligently. However, some students note that her classes are heavily exam-based, which can be challenging for those who struggle with consistent performance on exams.

Ratings.comment: What a cool lady. Genuinely, she is so funny and comes into lecture so prepared. Her exams are extremely fair so if you study well, there is no reason you shouldn't get an A.

I really liked this class with her. She makes the lectures interesting and is very clear on what will be tested. Everything in the class is pretty straightforward and she is very intelligible with all the topics. Exams are the majority of your grade, but they aren't too hard if you pay attention in lecture and write good notes.

Such a fun class and quite interesting. Her lectures are very easy to pay attention to, and she'll never test you over something she didn't talk about in class. Your grade is mostly exams, but they aren't too bad. I'm looking forward to taking more classes with her in the future!

I have gotten Cs and Bs on all of the exams so far and I had a B in this class until this one 5-point homework assignment that I forgot to do that she won't let me make up. Even if I get 100%s on the rest of the assignments and the final exam, I will get a C in the class. This is very frustrating when I have had a B the whole semester before this.
She is straightforward, entertaining, and available for help - all you have to do is ask. I wish I could take her for every class - hands down the best prof I've ever had.
Dr. Dunlevy is a horrible professor to say the least. She will make you feel ashamed of yourself and is friendly. I recommend a different professor at all costs.

I love Dr. Dunlevy. She's hilarious and I really enjoyed going to her lectures. She will absolutely tell it to you straight. This class was pretty difficult content wise, but the exams weren't too bad if you studied a decent amount. Only negative is your grade is almost completely (86%) based on exams, so you have to do well on them consistently.

I've had 3 different classes with her now, and this was by far my favorite class with her. She has lots of life experiences that helps explain the material. But, also beware that while attendance isn't mandatory, attending is the only way you will get all the material needed for exams. Only grades are exams and a few short assignments.

I really did not enjoy her teaching style. When asked questions outside of class she is condescending, rude, and doesnt explain very well. I read the text to do well in her class since the lectures were cursory at best. I think she knows what she is talking about, but is not able to convey it very well, at least with the online class edition.

She honestly has been one of my favorite professors so far! I always looked forward to going to her lectures. She is very interesting and funny, the class was almost always laughing. Attending lectures wasn't mandatory, but I made sure to go because she provided information needed for exams. She also gave bonus questions on exams. Love her!

She is hands down my favorite professor I have ever had. I purposely scheduled more classes with her just because I loved her that much. Definitely attend and pay attention or you won't pass, but she makes it so easy to pay attention. So hilarious and sassy, but she is very clear and definitely knows what she is talking about. 100% recommend

Really funny, great lecturer. Will not hesitate to call you out and is always happy to share her opinion. Class itself was pretty easy but she doesn't always explain assignments too well. The exams can be a little tricky but if you get high Bs/low As on them and complete the other couple assignments (graded on completion), you'll get an A.

I really loved Dr. Dunlevy, she was super funny in lecture which made it a lot more interesting to come to and she was very good at making time for questions and making sure people understood the content. You only get graded on the exams and a few short quizzes so you definitely have to study hard.

I found myself laughing at her sassy humor that helped keep the class attentive, but beware of the fact that pre-reviewing lecture slides, taking good notes during lecture, and studying fairly heavily still doesn't result in getting a strong grade in this class. Good professor (although a little harsh), but the class was harder that it needed to be

Best professor I've ever had here. Her style of teaching was a bit crazy at times but she was always willing to go back and explain things as many times as we needed. Her stories during lecture are always hilarious and borderline crazy and she made attending lecture fun. Tests are fair, hard class and requires a lot of work but doable if you study.

By far my favorite class/professor I have had at any of my 3 colleges. Attendance is not mandatory, but her lectures are hilarious and extremely helpful. The only grades are 5 exams and 4 short assignments, so be sure to study! The exams are taken directly from her powerpoints/lectures. She is very straightforward and just an amazing professor.

Not exactly sure what to say about Dunlevy. Most days shes hilarious and real. Other days she can be hard to respect. Definitely likes maintaining the authority in the classroom. Dont say something out of line or against her or else she will call you out on it immediately. Overall shes really great, just dont put yourself on her bad side.

Dunlevy is my favorite professor ever. Between her hilarious commentary and knowledge about disparities, there's something wrong with you if her class doesn't change at least one of your perspectives in life. It isn't just her opinion, she has the expertise and research to back it up.

Don't let her laid back style fool you. Typical "figure it out in your own" prof. Not helpful at all. Extremely critical when it comes to grading but yet her instructions explain the absolute bare minimum.  After you complete the assignment, according to her guidelines, she takes off points based on details that were never clarified.

Dr. Dunlevy goes right up to the top of my favorite professor list. Her whole attitude of "do less" and "I don't care" is brash, hysterical and relatable to college students. Did I mention she's also a good teacher and not just funny? Well, she is. Just because she says "I don't care" and cusses doesn't mean she hates her job. She's great. 11/10

I heart Dunlevy!  She knows more, is cooler, and gives a damn about more things than any prof I have had at OSU. I have learned more from her and her style of teaching than anybody. Dunlevy walks the walk.

Dunlevy is the only prof in the school who makes you think. about everything. She has honestly made a difference in the way I think about politics, issues, and argument. She doesn't care what side of an issue you take, but you best be prepared to defend it on more than a knee-jerk response.

Dunlevy IS COOL, FUNNY, ENERGETIC... However, the material is very boring and abstract. We all understand that being poor directly correlates with being unhealthy. Why the hell do we care about every spit of detail about it. The only way to study is to MEMORIZE, there are very few patterns but a large amount of slide material to look at.
Seriously, If you do not absolutely LOVE her, there is something wrong with you! Most entertaining and fair professor ever!
best...teacher...on...the...planet.
Dunlevy rocks!

We all think Dunlevy is just bad-ass (and she is) but I had a low point and she friggin' hugged me.  Meant more to me than if some regular person had hugged me - just sayin'.  She makes an effort to know you and she genuinely cares about all of us. She is one in a million - you will be better for making her your role model. And she's funny as hell.

I just really like her - she is down to earth and she really knows not just the subject matter, but how to teach.  Dr. Dunlevy is lively and makes going to class enjoyable.  I will be sad when I can't take her for another course.

I like her as a teacher and a human being.  She is very genuine, funny, and she watches too much TV! I am learning so much and I look forward to her class each week.  She uses examples from real life and I love to hear her stories.
The real deal. I dreaded this course (evidence-based practice), but I learned a lot and had fun doing it. She uses relevant examples that I could relate to.
Dr. Dunlevy is no joke - she is scary smart and has a razor-sharp wit. I really learned a lot in her class - she had me arguing health care reform with my Republican family and winning the debate!
Hands down, the best teacher I've ever had.  She will go the extra mile to make sure you get it. You'll love her.
She's Jim Gaffigan in a skirt.  Loved her.
She's a rock star!  Far ahead of the curve re: any professor I've had.
Knows what she's talking about and how to teach it. I never missed class, even though it met for 3 hours on Monday nite - it's a floor show!  Who else uses "chopped and screwed" in the right context?
She is a riot!  I never thought I would enjoy going to a medical terminology class but I actually looked forward to it.  Knows the material cold, too.

summary_comment: Professor Clutter is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style, making classes enjoyable and accessible. Students appreciate her supportive approach and the manageable grading criteria, though some note her organization can be inconsistent. Overall, her classes are considered valuable and manageable with a focus on active participation and timely preparation.
summary_comment_short: Professor Clutter is highly regarded for her engaging and passionate teaching style, making classes enjoyable and accessible, though her lectures can be somewhat disorganized. Students appreciate her supportive approach and the relatively manageable grading system, though some find her class structure and expectations can be inconsistent.

Ratings.comment: Super nice professor and has interesting content. The exams were not super difficult as a lot of the information was intuitive. There is a semester-long group project that is divided into three parts but they did not grade it super critically. Mini assignments during class count as a part of the grade and as long as you show up, you should be fine.

Dr. Clutter is such a joyful and spirited professor. She is also passionate about the course content and will often use anecdotes to help students learn. Overall, she made an 8am easier to wake up for and listen to.

Dr. Clutter is one of the best professors I've had during my time at Ohio State. She genuinely cares about each of her students. The slides she provides are vague so it is important to go to class. The textbook was required, but I didn't open it all year. Her exams take a little more studying than you might think, but overall this class is not bad!

Dr. Clutter's apparently vast knowledge of topics we covered, coupled with her skillful personable instruction style, facilitated our curiosity about- and better understanding of the healthcare systems with- and in which many of us now work.

Clutter was exactly like her name. She was disorganized and sporadic. I ended up with a B- in her class because there were few points in the class and she messed up a grade. After grades were posted, I reached out to her several times to get the mistake fixed with no reply. Nice lady, but all over the place and unreliable.

Dr. Clutter is a great teacher and an even better person. It is clear that Dr. Clutter is at Ohio State because of her passion for her students and her ability to impact our lives. If you have the chance to take a class with Dr. Clutter, please do.

She's great. her tests are not really hard, but you should definitely study before hand. There are only 4 tests and two projects in the class that you get graded on. I told her I was worried about my grade and she waved me off and told me not to worry about it. Spends first half of class talking about "for the good of the cause" (current events).

She is so funny and sweet! Her tests aren't hard per se, but make sure you study and read parts of the book that pertain to lecture. Take good notes. Projects are easy and participation is graded and both with save your test grades. I still got an A. It's also better to not miss class, because she says a lot that aren't necessarily on slides!

summary_comment: Professor Wolf is known for her high standards and clear expectations, making her courses challenging but fair. While some students find her demeanor intimidating and condescending, others appreciate her availability and willingness to listen. Her effectiveness as a professor is highly debated, with some students praising the clarity of her information and the usefulness of her materials, while others strongly advise against her due to issues with her presentations and quiz questions.
summary_comment_short: Professor Wolf is known for her high standards and clear expectations, making her a challenging yet fair instructor who is approachable once students get past her intimidating demeanor. Alternatively, some students find her lectures and materials poorly prepared and difficult to follow, advising others to avoid her classes.

Ratings.comment: Kay Wolf is a no-nonsense type of teacher.  She lets you know what her expectations are and does not accept any less.  Very fair, always willing to listen, people get intimidated by her demeanor but she really is there if you need her, even if it's just to vent.

She is completely useless as a professor.  Her slides are pathetic and riddled with spelling errors and grammatical errors.  He quiz and test questions originate from her own mind, definitely not the book or her "study questions." Avoid her at all possible costs!

All info is clear and the book she teaches with helps a lot, if you read the book,and do the study guides you will get an A. She is not the most pleasent person though, seems very condescending to students.

summary_comment: Professor Miller is perceived as a disengaging instructor who lacks passion for her subject, according to students. Her classes are described as easy but marked by mandatory group work and public speaking, which some find disruptive.
summary_comment_short: Professor Miller is perceived as unengaging and dispassionate, with students finding her lectures and interactions impersonal and boring. Despite the class being relatively easy, her teaching style is considered less effective due to a lack of enthusiasm.

Ratings.comment: As a 4th year student I can without a doubt say that Meghan was my least favorite professor/teacher I've had throughout college. Very boring, uncaring, and disrespectful in our out of lecture interactions. Clearly there just for a job, not cause she's passionate about her profession. With that said, the class is easy just not a fan of her.

Be prepared to do lots of stuff in groups of people  and having to talk out loud in a lecture hall full of people if she picks your group to explain stuff. This class was very interactive in my opinion for it being in a lecture hall.
